snippet: Ueli Steck climbed the 26,545-foot Annapurna last year on his own. He has been awarded the Piolet d’Or, mountaineering’s highest honor.
abstract: Ueli Steck is awarded the Piolet d'Or, moutaineering's highest honor, for becoming the first climber to reach the south face summit of Nepal's 26,545-foot Annapurna, considered by many to be the world's most technically challenging climb; his recognition comes amid controversy, however, because he can provide no material evidence of his feat.
lead_paragraph: Ueli Steck climbed the 26,545-foot Annapurna last year on his own. He has been awarded the Piolet d’Or, mountaineering’s highest honor.

headline.main: Swiss Climber’s Feat Honored Despite Lack of Proof
headline.print_headline: Reaching New Heights the Hard Way
